childLayers.title: Populatable Child Layers
childLayers.ownDataOptionsDescription: 1 layer has its own data source configuration which will be used when populating.
childLayers.ownDataOptionsDescriptionPlural: {count} layers have their own data source configurations which will be used when populating.
childLayers.noPopulatableLayersDescription: There are no populatable child layers.

learn.title: LEARN
learn.subtitle: Get started and master populating designs with data.

one.instructions: Add dynamic data templates with ^{placeholders} to your design mockups - these can be for both text and images.

two.instructions: Use local JSON or remote API Data Sources that correspond to the ^{placeholders} in your data templates.

three.instructions: Populating those ^{placeholders} with meaningful data makes your design mockups more realistic.

contentTemplateArtboard.title: Name Template for Artboard
contentTemplateArtboard.description: The tempate for the name of your Artboard.

contentTemplateText.title: Content Template for Text
contentTemplateText.description: The template for the content of your Text – e.g. Hello ^{placeholder}. ^{placeholder} will be populated with the respective data.

contentTemplateShape.title: Content Template for Shape
contentTemplateShape.description: The template for your Image Shape.

dataSource.title: Data Source
dataSource.description: Where your data is being taken from. You can create your own Data Sources and reuse them across your Documents. A Data Source can be either a local JSON file or a URL, e.g. an online JSON file or an API endpoint with dedicated Headers.

urlVariableOverrides.title: URL Variable Overrides
urlVariableOverrides.description: Override default URL variable values set for this data source to use dynamic variations of data.

rootPath.title: Root Path
rootPath.description: The Root Path of your JSON. Use it if your JSON is nested and you only want to use deeper levels of your data.

usedDataSources.title: Used Data Sources
usedDataSources.description: All Data Sources used in the current document.

documentDataSources.title: Document Data Sources
documentDataSources.description: Data Sources that are stored in this document. When you share the document, the Data Sources will remain available. If a Data Source exists both in the document and in the library, the document version will take precedence.

libraryDataSources.title: Library Data Sources
libraryDataSources.description: Data Sources that are stored in your library. They are only available to you and can be used across your projects. Add library Data Sources to the document to make them available to others.

dataSourceType.title: Data Source Type
dataSourceType.description: Data Sources can be either Local or Remote. Local refers to a locally referenced JSON file. Remote a to an online JSON file or an API endpoint.

dataSourceDestination.title: Data Source Destination
dataSourceDestination.description: Select the destination to which you would like to store the new Data Source.

defaultFallbackArtboard.title: Default Data Fallback
defaultFallbackArtboard.description: If your Data Source doesn't contain data for the selected item, the Fallback will be used instead. For an email address, this could be something like 'No email address available'. Add a '?' to your placeholder to indicate the use of a fallback – like {email?}.

defaultFallbackText.title: Default Data Fallback for Text
defaultFallbackText.description: If your Data Source doesn't contain data for the selected item, the Fallback will be used instead. For an email address, this could be something like 'No email address available'. Add a '?' to your placeholder to indicate the use of a fallback – like {email?}.

defaultFallbackShape.title: Fallback for Shape
defaultFallbackShape.description: If your Data Source doesn't contain data for the selected item, the Fallback will be used instead.

dataSources.title: Data sources
dataSources.description: No data sources available. Add one to start populating your designs with meaningful data.

textTrimming.title: Text Trimming
textTrimming.description: If your data needs more space than your Text Layer provides, you can configure to trim it and optionally display an Elipsis after the cutoff.

urlVariables.title: URL Variables
urlVariables.description: Define dynamic parts of your data source URL by using ^{variable} placeholders. Assign default variable values and override them on per-instance basis when using this data source.

populatedData.title: CLEAR POPULATED DATA
populatedData.info: Remove populated data from selected layers. Original content of text layers will be restored. Images will be set to placeholders.

options.title: CLEAR OPTIONS
options.info: Remove all options such as content templates and data sources associated with selected layers.

artboard.title: ARTBOARD SELECTION
artboard.footer: Restore original content and reset layer settings.

editDataSource.title: EDIT DATA SOURCE
editDataSource.footer: All layers using this data source will no longer be populated.

group.title: GROUP SELECTION
group.footer: Restore original content and reset layer settings.

multiSelection.title: MULTI SELECTION
multiSelection.subtitle: Populate multiple supported layers at once.
multiSelection.footer: Restore original content and reset layer settings.

shape.title: SHAPE SELECTION
shape.footer: Restore original content and reset layer settings.

text.title: TEXT SELECTION
text.footer: Restore original content and reset layer settings.

unsupportedSelection.title: UNSUPPORTED SELECTION
unsupportedSelection.subtitle: Current layer selection cannot be populated.
